SENT.plain: Our purpose is to discuss MRI findings in non-ischemic myocardial disease (NIMD)
Emphasis is placed on the typical locations and patterns of delayed enhancement

Clinicopathological and MRI features of amyloidosis, arrythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia, left ventricular non-compaction, myocarditis, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, and dilated cardiomyopathy are discussed
Currently, cardiac MRI is the best imaging method for diagnosis and follow-up of NIMD
In particular, the radiologist should be familiar with the different patterns of delayed enhancement on DE-CMR since they play an important role in the detection and differential diagnosis of NIMD
